intro: Leucopogon angustatus, commonly known as the narrowleaf heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in woodland or coastal areas. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Leucopogon angustatus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
